body: Thanks for the clean-up - looks good! I'm merging this.
I'm guessing it's something random. I'll merge this as soon as it passes.

@pwendell 
Thank you, this patch works

But this only solve one problem. The Spark dependence is fixed, we can only use log4j.

In SparkBuild.scala file:

```
    "log4j"                      % "log4j"            % "1.2.17",
    "org.slf4j"                  % "slf4j-api"        % slf4jVersion,
    "org.slf4j"                  % "slf4j-log4j12"    % slf4jVersion,
    "org.slf4j"                  % "jul-to-slf4j"     % slf4jVersion,
    "org.slf4j"                  % "jcl-over-slf4j"   % slf4jVersion,
```

To become a configurable logging system?
Jenkins, test this please. (sorry I rebooted jenkins).
Jenkins, retest this please (sorry I rebooted jenkins).

no we don't need to change the dependencies. The case I wanted to handle was if users downstream remove the dependencies (e.g. they remove "jul-to-slf4j") and do a custom spark build. This is something people actually do.

Hey @mateiz @willb @andrewor14 @mengxr,

I've been trying to investigate a bunch of Jenkins failures in other pull requests and I believe they might be a result of this patch being merged in. I've reverted this patch in master as the next step. Tomorrow we can see if this fixes the issues. If it doesn't apologies for the false warning. Note that this means this pull request will need to be re-opened.

@pwendell after this commit i saw there are too many whitespaces in the codebase, i've managed to fix them all, should i build a pull request for them ?
"Remove Unnecessary Whitespace's"

I'm seeing some Akka related problems in my local build but nothing that would seem related to this PR. The log forwarding seems to work.

@pwendell thanks a lot for the help on this. I think in the interest of getting the saveAsParquetFile working inside the console that should be merged soon.
OK, I found a couple of failures after rebasing.  I'll look at this today and figure out where things are going wrong.  Thanks, and sorry for the confusion!
Not sure why the build is failing as I'm pretty sure this change isn't touching any of those two things.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

This seems to be failing tests unfortunately -- click through to the Jenkins log. This is what it says:

```
=========================================================================
Running PySpark tests
=========================================================================
**********************************************************************
File "pyspark/mllib/_common.py", line 76, in __main__._deserialize_double_vector
Failed example:
    array_equal(x, _deserialize_double_vector(_serialize_double_vector(x)))
Exception raised:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/doctest.py", line 1289, in __run
        compileflags, 1) in test.globs
      File "<doctest __main__._deserialize_double_vector[1]>", line 1, in <module>
        array_equal(x, _deserialize_double_vector(_serialize_double_vector(x)))
      File "pyspark/mllib/_common.py", line 55, in _serialize_double_vector
        if numpy.issubdtype(v.dtype, numpy.complex):
    NameError: global name 'numpy' is not defined
**********************************************************************
   1 of   2 in __main__._deserialize_double_vector
***Test Failed*** 1 failures.
Had test failures; see logs.
```

This is why it would be good to add a test actually. For instance you can add a test with `_deserialize_double_vector(_serialize_double_vector(array([1,2,3]))` and check that it returns `array([1.0,2.0,3.0])`.
Is there an accompanying JIRA? Could you add a brief summary and/or a motivation?
@AndreSchumacher it's likely related to an accidental merge of a buggy patch into master... try rebasing to the latest master which includes a reversion of the bug.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
@tdas Let me know when you want to merge with master. #204 was just merged in and there will be plenty of UI conflicts. :)
